subject: Politics
title: Austerity vs Stimulus
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: Austerity vs Stimulus.

hook.text: After 2008, Europe chose austerity. The US chose stimulus. America recovered faster. The debate raged on.

buildup.text: Austerity means cutting government spending to reduce debt. Stimulus means spending more to boost the economy.

discovery.text: Keynes argued that in a recession, only government spending can fill the gap left by falling private demand.

twist.text: Austerity in Greece caused GDP to fall 25% and unemployment to hit 27%. The cure was worse than the disease.

climax.text: COVID-19 ended the austerity debate â€” temporarily. Every government spent massively to prevent economic collapse.

punchline.text: Austerity saves money. Stimulus saves jobs. Timing decides which one works.

quiz.question: What happened when Greece implemented strict austerity after 2008?
options: The economy recovered within one year
